010package imagingbook.common.filter.edgepreserving;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
013
014import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
015import imagingbook.common.filter.edgepreserving.BilateralF.Parameters;
016import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilterVector;
017import imagingbook.common.filter.linear.GaussianKernel2D;
018import imagingbook.common.image.PixelPack;
019import imagingbook.common.math.VectorNorm;
020
021/**
022 * Vector version, for RGB images only (accepts {@link ColorProcessor} only).
023 * This class implements a bilateral filter as proposed in
024 * C. Tomasi and R. Manduchi, "Bilateral Filtering for Gray and Color Images",
025 * Proceedings of the 1998 IEEE International Conference on Computer Vision,
026 * Bombay, India.
027 * The filter uses Gaussian domain and range kernels and can be applied to all 
028 * image types.
029 * 
030 * @author W. Burger
031 * @version 2021/01/01
032 */
033public class BilateralFilterVector extends GenericFilterVector {
034        
035        private final float[][] Hd;     // the domain kernel
036        private final int K;            // the domain kernel size [-K,...,K]
037        private final double sigmaR2;
038        private final VectorNorm colorNorm;
039        private final double colorScale2;
040        
041        public BilateralFilterVector() {
042                this(new Parameters());
043        }
044        
045        public BilateralFilterVector(Parameters params) {
046                GaussianKernel2D kernel = new GaussianKernel2D(params.sigmaD);
047                this.Hd = kernel.getH();
048                this.K = kernel.getXc();
049                this.sigmaR2 = sqr(params.sigmaR);
050                this.colorNorm = params.colorNormType.create();
051                this.colorScale2 = sqr(colorNorm.getScale(3));
052        }
053        
054        @Override
055        protected float[] doPixel(PixelPack pack, int u, int v) {
056                float[] S = new float[3];       // sum of weighted RGB values
057                float W = 0;                            // sum of weights
058                float[] a = pack.getVec(u, v);                  // value of the current center pixel
059                
060                for (int m = -K; m <= K; m++) {
061                        for (int n = -K; n <= K; n++) {
062                                float[] b = pack.getVec(u + m, v + n);
063                                float wd = Hd[m + K][n + K];                            // domain weight
064                                float wr = similarityGauss(a, b);                       // range weight
065                                float w = wd * wr;
066                                S[0] = S[0] + w * b[0];
067                                S[1] = S[1] + w * b[1];
068                                S[2] = S[2] + w * b[2];
069                                W = W + w;
070                        }
071                }
072                S[0] = S[0] / W;
073                S[1] = S[1] / W;
074                S[2] = S[2] / W;
075                return S;
076        }
077        
078        // ------------------------------------------------------
079        
080        // This returns the weights for a Gaussian range kernel (color vector version):
081        private float similarityGauss(float[] A, float[] B) {
082                double d2 = colorScale2 * colorNorm.distance2(A, B);
083                return (float) Math.exp(-d2 / (2 * sigmaR2));
084        }
085}
